heading: rants & raves
subheading: date: thu, 23 dec 1999 09:21:55 -0800 from: alice goldberg (alicegold@earthlink.net) to: newsfeedback@wired.com subject: analog vs digital it may be true what you wrote about the advantages of an analog over a digital camera (“new camera? go analog,” 23.dec.99), but for a few mementos i’ll take my digital over my analog any time. i tend […]
author: wired blogs
text: date: thu, 23 dec 1999 09:21:55 -0800 from: alice goldberg (alicegold@earthlink.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: analog vs digitalit may be true what you wrote about the advantages of an analog over a digital camera ("new camera? go analog," 23.dec.99), but for a few mementos i'll take my digital over my analog any time. i tend to take pictures, develop them, look at them, show them to a few friends, and they go into the drawer never to be seen again. i just finished a trip with my daughter, and she lugged along 20 rolls of film, which she tried unsuccessfully to keep out of the airport scanners. i just took along two little cards, and had enough memory to take all the pictures i wanted – and, an extra set of batteries. i had no problem, and got some nice pictures that i sent over the internet to my friends. i didn't have to scan them, and the quality was plenty good enough for me. i'm not after professional quality prints. i just want to get a quick shot of something by which to remember the trip. i'll never travel with my analog again.
